edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.serialization

Class ThreadSafeThriftSerializer<T extends org.apache.thrift.TBase<T,? extends org.apache.thrift.TFieldIdEnum>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.serialization.ThreadSafeThriftSerializer<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ThriftSerializer<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompactCommunicationSerializer

    public class ThreadSafeThriftSerializer<T extends org.apache.thrift.TBase<T,? extends org.apache.thrift.TFieldIdEnum>>
extends Object
implements ThriftSerializer<T>
    Utility class for convenient serialization of Thrift-like data structures.
    Author:
    max

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ThreadSafeThriftSerializer()
      Use a default strategy, TCompactProtocol, to de/serialize Thrift-like objects.

      • fromBytes

        public T fromBytes(T object,
                   byte[] bytez)
            throws ConcreteException
        Generic method to deserialize a thrift-like object.
        Specified by:
        fromBytes in interface ThriftSerializer<T extends org.apache.thrift.TBase<T,? extends org.apache.thrift.TFieldIdEnum>>
        Parameters:
        object - - a 'thrift-like' [TBase] object that will be deserialized into. In other words, if you were reading in a Communication byte array, you should pass in a new Communication() object as the first parameter.
        bytez - - the byte array that holds the serialized TBase object.
        Returns:
        a deserialized TBase object.
        Throws:
        ConcreteException - if there is an error during deserialization.
